indicators.justification:
Although there are official publications regarding climate vulnerability, the datasets are not available much less in machine-readable formats(1).

Climate vulnerability information is available in the form of reports(2) on topics such as land monitoring; Monitoring of surface waters; Monitoring of groundwater; Monitoring of atmospheric air; Monitoring of the ozone layer; Monitoring of flora; Forest monitoring; Monitoring of the fauna; Geophysical monitoring; Radiation monitoring; Comprehensive monitoring of ecosystems in protected areas; Social and hygienic monitoring; Monitoring and forecasting of natural and man-made emergencies, etc...

indicators.justification:
Journalists using a database of registration data of citizens hacked by hyperpartisan were able to estimate the more likely results through mortality rates(1). 

Citation: One dismal revelation the group recently reported on Telegram was that COVID-19 deaths in Belarus are likely to have been drastically under-reported to the World Health Organization.

The country's national statistics portal, Belstat, stopped publishing new mortality data in June 2020. But CP's passport system hack included the personal data of 1.4 million Belarusians who had died from January 2010 to March 2021.

Independent analysis by the TV channel Current Time found that excess deaths – the number of recorded deaths more than what would be expected in a normal year – from March 2020 to March 2021 stood at 32,000. The country's officially reported COVID-19 death toll in March was 2,247 (2).

Source:
(1):https://www.euronews.com/2021/09/14/the-regime-is-bleeding-brains-meet-the-hackers-trying-to-bring-down-belarus-disputed-presi
(2):https://www.currenttime.tv/a/smertnost-v-belarusi/31401342.html

indicators.justification:
The Ministry of Finance provides an Open Budget tool(1) to access budget data and download various datasets in xlsx or pdf formats. The ministry also provides an interactive map to visualize budget data in different localities and at the level of various sub-national divisions(2). Additionally, detailed reports and citizen's guides are published on yearly basis, along with a table using Special Data Dissemination Standard / SDDS(3).

Sources:
1. https://www.minfin.gov.by/en/budgetary_policy/docnew/76527deb8efb478b.html
2.https://minfin.gov.by/en/budgetary_policy/docnew/72f53797158541c4.html
3.https://www.minfin.gov.by/en/sdds/

There is a government agency in charge of monitoring the adherence to the restrictions set by article 24. of The Law On Political Parties(1), and since political parties are mandated to send reports of their financial activities (and other activities) to the General Procurator of the Republic of Belarus (article 26.), it can be assumed that this data is collected and archived in some form. It should also be noted that no party sets a political task to use open data, official information on the president's website (2).

indicators.justification:
Despite the existence of regulation of public consultations, there is no single resource, format, and information about these consultations. The websites of state bodies are not unified and information on public consultations has to be sought by interested parties on their own. However, The site "Legal Forum of Belarus" (1) is an information resource in the field of law and legal informatization. Designed to provide an opportunity for lawyers and visitors to the resource of interactive communication with each other on issues related to law, law enforcement practice, clarification of legislation. Here users can leave comments below draft regulations and all these are available on the website to be viewed by visitors.

Sources:
(1):https://forumpravo.by/default.aspx

indicators.justification:
In accordance with subparagraph 2 of article 19 of the Law of the Republic of Belarus "On amendments and additions to the Law of the Republic of Belarus" On public procurement of goods (works, services)"(1), the annual public procurement plan is formed annually and after approval by the customer is subject to placement on the electronic trading platform within five working days, with the exception of information constituting state secrets.

Changes and (or) additions to the annual public procurement plan are made by the customer in the order in which the annual public procurement plan was approved, and after approval by the customer, they are also subject to placement on the electronic trading platform within five working days, with the exception of information constituting state secrets.

Operators of the electronic trading platform www.goszakupki.by and the state information and analytical system www.gias.by ensuring the placement of the annual public procurement plan, changes, and (or) additions to such a plan in the state information and analytical system.

Sources:

1.https://pravo.by/document/?guid=12551&p0=H11800136&p1=1

indicators.justification:
Unfortunately, there have never been any strong initiatives. As can be understood in a closed authoritarian state, the transparency of the work of state bodies is not provided.
There in no active open data initiative as such, however, there is a website from the national statistics committee providing data on several areas: http://dataportal.belstat.gov.by/

responses.response_text: There is evidence of an active government-led open government data initiative.
responses.subquestion_text: Has there been any form of government-led open government data initiative during the study period?
There is a government team in place supporting open data activities.
There is an allocated budget for open data activities.
There is a well-maintained open data portal.
There is guidance and support for government publication of open data.
Senior political leaders back the open data initiative.

indicators.justification: Activists regularly mismatch data in even the official publications of the statistical committee. Citizens can only guess and have no way to check the reliability of government data. Economic crises show that the government does not know how to work with data.

responses.response_text: There is no evidence of capability to effectively manage data.
responses.subquestion_text: To what extent do city, regional, and local governments have the capability to effectively manage data?
There is evidence of local governments having open data initiatives.
There is evidence of local governments having current open data policies in place.
There is evidence of local governments having rules and or guidance in place to provide a comprehensive framework for data sharing.
There is evidence of local governments having rules and or guidance in place for consistent data management and publication.
There is evidence of local governments providing training to civil servants on data literacy and skills.
There is evidence of local governments providing support for data reuse.

indicators.justification: Civil society organizations have often provided training in this area. These organizations were repressed by the government in July-September 2021

responses.response_text: There is no evidence of government supporting civil servants training on data matters.
responses.subquestion_text: Is there evidence of  government´s actions to train civil servants on data matters?
Training delivered covers data frameworks and governance topics.
Training delivered to public servants covers topics on data gathering.
Training delivered covers data analysis, visualisations and storytelling techniques.
Training delivered covers specific technical topics for data centred roles.
Training on data addresses non-technical public servants.
Training on data is focused on specific positions already working with data.
Training is planned by an established training team, department, or agency.
Public servants receive a certification when taking a training so there is a formal recognition as a professional development.

indicators.justification: Unfortunately, it is impossible to answer this question due to the lack of general transparency of political processes in Belarus.

responses.response_text: The datasets do not share common identifiers.
responses.subquestion_text: There is evidence that datasets share common identifiers.
The key datasets for this theme share common identifiers that facilitate mapping flows across the data ecosystem.
The different political integrity datasets use common identifiers for public officials.
Lobbying data and political finance data share common identifiers for lobbyist clients and party and campaign donors.
Lobbying registers and public consultation data use common identifiers for regulations.
Asset declarations and political finance disclosures share common identifiers for interests, assets, and liabilities.
The various datasets share common identifiers for legal persons associated with donations, interests, assets, liabilities, and lobbying activities.
The key datasets for the political integrity and company information modules share common identifiers that facilitate mapping flows across the data ecosystem.
The key datasets for the political integrity and land modules share common identifiers that facilitate mapping flows across the data ecosystem.
The key datasets for the political integrity and public finance modules share common identifiers that facilitate mapping flows across the data ecosystem.
The key datasets for the political integrity and public procurement modules share common identifiers that facilitate mapping flows across the data ecosystem.

responses.response_text: A framework exists but lacks full force of law.

The framework requires data controllers to notify an appropriate authority of data breaches.
Frameworks explicitly cover the protection of location-related data.
The framework addresses algorithmic decision making.
Exceptions to the usual data protection framework have been made as part of the country's COVID-19 response.

indicators.justification: as evidenced by the studied legal comments on the new law that is just entering into force, that the law turned out to be quite good, but the law enforcement is unknown. Especially in the situation of right-wing default in Belarus. On the other hand, the new law does not contain open data norms. We draw your attention to the fact that there are no political forces in the country that have fixed open data issues in their program or strategy.

responses.subquestion_text: What is the nature of the framework?
The framework establishes a common definition of open data.
The framework promotes open licensing without any restrictions beyond attribution and share-alike.
The framework requires to publish data in machine readable formats.
The rules/guidance requires the use of specific data standards.
The framework promotes training and capacity building among government officials.

indicators.justification:
The Ministry of Finance publishes the national budget in the form of a brochure(1).
In 2020 "Public Financial Management Modernization in the Republic of Belarus" was implemented in order to streamline some of the drafting procedures, although none of the improvements have to do with data structuring and publishing(2).
The main regulatory framework concerning public finances is the Budget Code of Belarus(3), however, the only mention of requirements to publish the data are given broadly in Article 5. not mentioning any structural or format requirements.

Sources:
1. https://www.minfin.gov.by/upload/bp/budjet/budjet2021.pdf
2. https://www.minfin.gov.by/upload/drugoe/86060_Audit%20Report_2020_eng.pdf
3. https://etalonline.by/document/?regnum=hk0800412#load_text_none_1_

indicators.justification:
The Law of the Republic of Belarus dated July 15, 2015 No. 305-З "On the fight against corruption" (1) mandates a list of public officials that are obligated to provide asset declarations. However, there is no mention of publication.

When property databases were hacked now, cyber guerrillas began to publish information about government officials. State propaganda launched a campaign of corruption in Ukraine.

Hackers hacked the state register of real estate of Belarus and laid out data on the land plot of Kurmanbek Bakiev (2).

The "Cyber-partisans" opposing Lukashenka received passport data and photos of ALL Belarusians. Present Time Factcheck and Hacker Interviews(3).

Sources:
(1):https://pravo.by/document/?guid=12551&p0=H11500305&p1=1
(2):https://kloop.kg/blog/2021/09/03/hakery-vzlomali-gosreestr-nedvizhimosti-belarusi-i-vylozhili-dannye-o-zemelnom-uchastke-kurmanbeka-bakieva/
(3):https://www.currenttime.tv/a/hakery-vzlomali-pasporta/31385554.html

indicators.justification:
Law About political parties (1) Article 24. mentions various restrictions on the financing of political parties and unions, however, there is no mention of publicizing or collecting this data in any form. But since there is a government agency in charge of monitoring the adherence to these restrictions and since political parties are mandated to send reports of their financial activities (and other activities), it can be assumed that this data is collected and archived in some form.

Sources:

(1):https://pravo.by/document/?guid=3871&p0=V19403266

indicators.justification:
The main regulatory text in regards to public consultations on rulemaking is The Decision of the Council of Ministers of the Republic of Belarus On public discussion of draft regulatory legal acts(1). The decision provides a basis for the publication of the notice of intent, the publication of proposed regulations, publication of comments generated through public consultation processes, and publication of final regulations and justification. However, it does not include any requirements related to data quality and structure.

Sources:
1.https://pravo.by/document/?guid=3871&p0=C21900056

indicators.justification:
International Expertise Of The Belarusian Draft Law On Information, Informatization And Information Protection (1). In Belarus, there is no specific public entity or and Information Ombudsman in charge of FOI matters. The NGOs operating in this field were also recently liquidated(2)(3).

Baltic Internet Policy Initiative, together with Lawtrend, carried out international expertise of the draft law. This was an example of a successful small project when the draft law was translated into English and sent out for an international examination and the received comments were translated into Russian and sent to all the deputies. Unfortunately, this was a one-time practice.

Sources:
(1): https://e-belarus.org/article/infolaw.html
(2):https://rtvi.com/news/verkhovnyy-sud-belorussii-likvidiroval-poslednyuyu-pravozashchitnuyu-organizatsiyu-v-strane/
(3):https://novayagazeta.ru/articles/2021/10/05/belorusskii-sud-likvidiroval-posledniuiu-pravozashchitnuiu-organizatsiiu-v-strane-news

indicators.justification:
Description service:
BizInspect.by is an online service for checking counterparties. The system is designed to check and assess the reliability of business entities of the Republic of Belarus. The system allows you to get up-to-date and archived information about the activities of companies and entrepreneurs, view and track changes in data on the status of the company, decision-making on changes in the statutory fund, bankruptcy and liquidation, litigation and other material facts that affect the assessment of the reliability of counterparties. Unfortunately, there is no evidence of any journalistic investigations referring to the register, Exception one legal comment(1)

Sources:

(1):https://neg.by/novosti/otkrytj/kak-obmanom-navyazyvayut-platnye-uslugi-sovsem-ne-deshevye

indicators.justification:
There is a small amount of data journalism in Belarus. Therefore, it is difficult to testify that the investigations carried out have made the situation more transparent.

Euroradio journalists in October 2021 investigated that some hospitals in Belarus significantly increased their purchases of pathology bags during the fourth wave of the coronavirus(1). This follows from the tenders they placed on the website goszakupki.by.
